title: Definitions
text: The macroscopic domain is the realm of everyday things that are large enough to be sensed directly by human sight or touch. Some aspects of the microscopic domain are visible through standard optical microscopes, for example, many biological cells, but most of the subjects in the microscopic domain of chemistry are too small to be seen even with the most advanced microscopes. The symbolic domain contains the specialized language used to represent components of the macroscopic and microscopic domains.

title: Scenario
text: The problem talks about molecules. Molecules are not large enough for us to see. Based on this, determine the answer.
